intro: Galium davuricum var. leiocarpum, commonly known as the smooth-fruited bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces tiny white or pale yellow flowers in clusters, which are typically followed by small, spherical berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and horticultural collections.
